info.title: Livestorm - Public API
info.description:
Welcome to Livestorm's Public API documentation.
The Livestorm API is organized around REST principles.
In addition, all request and response bodies, including errors, are encoded in JSON format.

get.description: Use the /ping endpoint to check if your API token works as expected. If you receive a 200 HTTP response code, it means that you've successfully authenticated!

parameters.name: page[size]
parameters.description: Number of record to be returned by page

get.description: List all the People (participants and team members) associated to your organization.

get.summary: Retrieve a someone's details for a Session
get.description: Get someone's details (participant or team member) for a given Session.

delete.description: Remove a registrant from the given Session.

get.description: Get the details of a Session.
Return the full list of Sessions associated to your organization.

parameters.name: page[size]
parameters.description: Number of record to be returned by page

parameters.name: filter[date_from]
parameters.description: Filter Sessions which ‘estimated_started_at’ attribute starts from the given date (expressed as a Unix timestamp or an ISO 8601 date).

parameters.name: filter[date_to]
parameters.description: Filter Sessions which ‘estimated_started_at’ attribute ends with the given date (expressed as a Unix timestamp or an ISO 8601 date).

get.description: List all the Sessions that belong to the given Event.

parameters.name: page[size]
parameters.description: Number of record to be returned by page

parameters.name: filter[date_from]
parameters.description: Filter Sessions which ‘estimated_started_at’ attribute starts from the given date (expressed as a Unix timestamp or an ISO 8601 date).

parameters.name: filter[date_to]
parameters.description: Filter Sessions which ‘estimated_started_at’ attribute ends with the given date (expressed as a Unix timestamp or an ISO 8601 date).

post.description:
Create a Webhook. The webhook events that you can subscribe to are the following ones:
- **event.published** : when a new event is published
- **people.registered** : when someone registers for an event session
- **session.started** : when an event session starts
- **session.ended** : when an event session ends
- **people.attended** : when someone attended an event session, after it ends
- **people.not_attended** : when someone didn’t attend an event session, after it ends

get.description: List all the webhooks of a workspace.

parameters.name: page[size]
parameters.description: Number of record to be returned by page

parameters.name: filter[event]
parameters.description: Filter Webhooks by event : event.published, session.started, session.ended, people.registered, people.attended, people.not_attended
